Certificates.Description: The SSL server certificate for the listener. With a certificate, you can encrypt traffic                                 between the load balancer and the clients that initiate HTTPS sessions, and traffic                                 between the load balancer and your targets.
Certificates.Required: Conditional. If you specify HTTPS for the Protocol property, specify a certificate.

DefaultActions.Description: The default actions that the listener takes when handling incoming requests.

LoadBalancerArn.Description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the load balancer to associate with the listener.

Port.Description: The port on which the listener listens for requests.For valid values, see the Port parameter for the CreateListener action in the Elastic Load Balancing API Reference version 2015-12-01.

Protocol.Description: The protocol that clients must use to send requests to the listener.For valid values, see the Protocol parameter for the CreateListener action in the Elastic Load Balancing API Reference version 2015-12-01.

SslPolicy.Description: The security policy that defines the ciphers and protocols that the load balancer                                 supports.

Actions.Description: The action that the listener takes when a request meets the specified condition.

Conditions.Description: The conditions under which a rule takes effect.

ListenerArn.Description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the listener that the rule applies to.

Priority.Description: The priority for the rule. Elastic Load Balancing evaluates rules in priority order,                                 from the lowest value to the highest value. If a request satisfies a rule, Elastic                                 Load Balancing ignores all subsequent rules.NoteA listener can have only one rule with a given priority.For valid values, see the Priority parameter for the CreateRule action in the Elastic Load Balancing API Reference version 2015-12-01.

HealthCheckIntervalSeconds.Description: The approximate number of seconds between health checks for an individual target.

HealthCheckPath.Description: The ping path destination where Elastic Load Balancing sends health check requests.

HealthCheckPort.Description: The port that the load balancer uses when performing health checks on the targets.For valid and default values, see the HealthCheckPort parameter for the CreateTargetGroup action in the Elastic Load Balancing API Reference version 2015-12-01.

HealthCheckProtocol.Description: The protocol that the load balancer uses when performing health checks on the targets,                                 such as HTTP or HTTPS.For valid and default values, see the HealthCheckProtocol parameter for the CreateTargetGroup action in the Elastic Load Balancing API Reference version 2015-12-01.

HealthCheckTimeoutSeconds.Description: The number of seconds to wait for a response before considering that a health check                                 has failed.

HealthyThresholdCount.Description: The number of consecutive successful health checks that are required before an unhealthy                                 target is considered healthy.

Matcher.Description: The HTTP codes that a healthy target uses when responding to a health check.

Name.Description: A name for the target group.ImportantThis name must be unique per account, per region.The target group name should be shorter than 22 characters because AWS CloudFormation                                    uses the target group name to create the name of the load balancer.

Port.Description: The port on which the targets receive traffic.

Protocol.Description: The protocol to use for routing traffic to the targets.

Tags.Description: An arbitrary set of tags (key–value pairs) for the target group. Use tags to help                                 manage resources.

Targets.Description: The targets to add to this target group.

UnhealthyThresholdCount.Description: The number of consecutive failed health checks that are required before a target is                                 considered unhealthy.

VpcId.Description: The ID of the VPC in which your targets are located.

Name.Description: Specifies a name for the load balancer. This name must be unique within your AWS                                 account and can have a maximum of 32 alphanumeric characters and hyphens. A name can't                                 begin or end with a hyphen.

Scheme.Description: Specifies whether the load balancer is internal or Internet-facing. An internal load                                 balancer routes requests to targets using private IP addresses. An Internet-facing                                 load                                 balancer routes requests from clients over the Internet to targets in your public                                 subnets.For valid and default values, see the Scheme parameter for the                                 CreateLoadBalancer action in the                                 Elastic Load Balancing API Reference version 2015-12-01.

SecurityGroups.Description: Specifies a list of the IDs of the security groups to assign to the load                                 balancer.

Subnets.Description: Specifies a list of at least two IDs of the subnets to associate with the load                                 balancer. The subnets must be in different Availability Zones.

Tags.Description: Specifies an arbitrary set of tags (key–value pairs) to associate with this                                 load balancer. Use tags to manage your resources.

IpAddressType.Description: The type of IP addresses that are used by the load balancer's subnets, such as                                 ipv4 (for IPv4 addresses) or dualstack (for IPv4 and IPv6                                 addresses). For valid values, see the IpAddressType parameter for the                                 CreateLoadBalancer action in the                                 Elastic Load Balancing API Reference version 2015-12-01.

CertificateArn.Description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the certificate to associate with the listener.

TargetGroupArn.Description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the target group to which Elastic Load Balancing                                 routes the traffic.

Type.Description: The type of action. For valid values, see the Type contents for the                                 Action data type in the                                 Elastic Load Balancing API Reference version 2015-12-01.

TargetGroupArn.Description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the target group to which Elastic Load Balancing                                 routes the traffic.

Type.Description: The type of action. For valid values, see the Type contents for the                                 Action data type in the                                 Elastic Load Balancing API Reference version 2015-12-01.

Field.Description: The name of the condition that you want to define, such as path-pattern (which forwards requests based on the URL of the request).For valid values, see the Field contents for the RuleCondition data type in the                                 Elastic Load Balancing API Reference version 2015-12-01.

Values.Description: The value for the field that you specified in the Field property.

HttpCode.Description: The HTTP codes that a healthy target must use when responding to a health check,                                 such as 200,202 or 200-399.For valid and default values, see the HttpCode contents for the Matcher data type in the Elastic Load Balancing API Reference version 2015-12-01.

Key.Description: The key name of the tag. You can specify a value that is 1 to 127 Unicode characters                                 in length and cannot be prefixed with aws:. You can use any of the following characters: the set of Unicode letters, digits,                                 whitespace, _, ., /, =, +, and -.

Value.Description: The value for the tag. You can specify a value that is 1 to 255 Unicode characters                                 in length and cannot be prefixed with aws:. You can use any of the following characters: the set of Unicode letters, digits,                                 whitespace, _, ., /, =, +, and -.

Key.Description: The name of the attribute that you want to configure. For the list of attributes that                                 you can configure, see the Key contents for the TargetGroupAttribute data type in the Elastic Load Balancing API Reference version 2015-12-01.

Id.Description: The ID of the target, such as an EC2 instance ID.

Port.Description: The port number on which the target is listening for traffic.

Key.Description: The name of an attribute that you want to configure. For the list of attributes that                                 you can configure, see the Key contents for the LoadBalancerAttribute data type in the Elastic Load Balancing API Reference version 2015-12-01.
